Name: niluanu
Title: Nice Temple
Review: ISKCON Temple in Chennai is conveniently located just off the East Coast Road. A large and aesthetically pleasing temple, the place is clean and well maintained. Car parking is available. There is a food court which opens at 11am and a shop where one can buy books and souvenirs. Prasadam is given out free. You do need to climb quite a few steps in order to reach the main temple hall.

Name: Venkataraman R
Title: Architecturally pleasing ISKCON temple
Review: Like other ISKCON temples, this Chennai ISKCON temple also architecturally marvellous and well maintained. Radha Krishna and other idols are well decorated and pleasing to the eyes. Temple is also very huge with lots of parking space and separate vegetarian restaurant inside the premises.Highly recommend for visit.

Name: Kiran Kumar
Title: Hare rama hare krishna
Review: Iskcon temple is known for its works and heritage. IT is very famous in Bangalore. Good that they have another one on Chennai.

Name: Deadman17
Title: Divine Place
Review: The Iskon Temple is a great monument, not just for the intricate carvings but for the divine atmosphere it has. One can enter and feel one's inner self becoming calm. A good place to meditate and relax and forget all your worries. The carvings are extremely well done and the whole place lights up at night giving a different dimension to the temple.

Name: Mrudula
Title: Lord Krishna
Review: This is one of the biggest ISKCON temple in chennai and located in 1.5 acres..Lord Krishna prayers are on everyday and it's a peaceful place to visit

Name: Gosthala
Title: A simple yet beautiful temple
Review: The ISKCON temple in Chennai is located in the ECR in the outskirts. Though the temple is located far from the city, it has not failed to gain the attention of the people. It is not only seen as a spiritual place but also a place to be admired for its interiors and the deities. One cannot deny that the beautiful idols of the Gods and the Goddesses do not let us keep our eyes off admiring them. There are different arathis performed at regular intervals. Bhajans and dances gear up the place with more spirit. Prasadham is offered every day at the temple. The temple is maintained well with neat and tidy premises. There are stalls to buy souvenir and divine items. canteens/restaurants are available within the premises.

Name: SjChennai
Title: Good Place to visit in ECR
Review: During special days, huge crowd is expected. Every one hr arthis are given to lord Krishna with devotional songs and small dance movements. location of the temple is away from pollution, residential buildings.

Name: Samy
Title: Awesome place
Review: I loved to go this place because it gives you very nice experience, temple is very nice you loved it.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: We started visiting this temple even before the construction completed
Review: We had been visiting the ISKCON temple even before completion of the temple. But every  experience was great. Can't forget. There were Bhajans, meditations held. Since this temple is also in ECR, while going to the temple and coming back from the temple were amazing. We enjoyed the ECR Road peaceful long rides along the sea shore parallel to the road. This is the best road in Chennai. Inside the temple they made us sing and dance. We enjoyed the Bhajans. There were many special festivals, personality development classes held here. We enjoyed many activities. Food was moderately spicy But very tasty. I wonder the food must have got the taste because of the mass mediations and Bhajans. We could buy some books too.

Name: Manoj G
Title: ISKCON always good
Review: when in a city and near to ISKCON temple it is imperative to visit it.Temple environment filled me with positive energy and had pleasant soul filling time inside permises.

Name: Bela
Title: Serene
Review: Very clean temple with tranquility Washrooms available Restaurant available Lil away from city Must visit

Name: Arun
Title: Krishna Temple
Review: Iskcon has built a beautiful temple for Krishna in the outskirts of Chennai. The place is very calm and you get Prasadham anytime you visit the temple. You can also meditate in the central hall where the Krishna is worshipped along with his consort.

Name: Bala Tripura S
Title: Peaceful temple on ECR Road
Review: This temple is on the ECR road and we need to walk little inside to reach this temple.Ib this temple we can see the idols of Lord Krishna,Radha along with her friends Lalitha &visaka.There are the idols fo Lord Jagannath,Balaram and subhadra.They decorted all the idols with beautiful cloths and jewellary.This temple had very peaceful environment and they carry out evening aarthi also.

Name: SAAGOBAA
Title: deep mediation
Review: one of most beautiful architecture and this place is for spiritual and deep mediation. like yoga and it is very beautiful and clean place.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Beautiful temple located in ECR Road
Review: I love this temple. We really enjoyed the visit and experienced the peaceful bhajans and calmness. Also had prasad. You must definitely visit this temple during Krishna Janmashtami. Beautiful temple. You will dance with the mesmerizing music and songs.

Name: Raguram R
Title: You cannot miss this temple..
Review: I was there around the temple area for a marriage and i took a break to see the lord, with family. Wonderful experience. I was lucky enough to be in and around the Aarathi time and it gave me the goosebumps. You can have peaceful darshan of the lord and stand however long you want and that is so precious.The pujaris are very dedicated and they did a wonderful puja. it was a wholesome experience. The temple walls are decorated with Krishna paintings and each one of them excelling the other. Temple as per ISKCON standards was neat and well maintained. Do not miss it..

Name: Mital_Ashish
Title: Must Visit place in Chennai
Review: It is a place that you should visit in Chennai, though there are so many other temples which are better than this. Good and Quiet place to meditate

Name: anil k
Title: Devotional
Review: Recently visited this temple with my friends,A classy temple and the food outside the temple I mean the food court is costlier for the quantity they provided.Dont buy food from there not at all good taste and quantity.

Name: JANET S
Title: A work now in progress.
Review: Based on marketing info with photos(?) I expected the new temple to be a must visit.  However, the new temple is far from finished.  Long drive in the ISKON bus.  If you are going to make a one-day trip, must know what to see and RUN around.  Otherwise, better to book a room and stay over night.  The cows are interesting.  Well-cared for and BIG cows and bulls!  ISKON is in favor of cow preservation.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Branch of iskcon
Review: The temple is dedicated to lord krishna which is built and well maintained by the famous jakson group.this has a well organised parking facility.

Name: musictraveler40
Title: Incredible
Review: Here in America, you hear about Hare Krishna and maybe you know a little, maybe you don't know anything. You go to India and pay attention, you'll learn - and if you're lucky, like me, you'll get to go and meditate at a wonderful place like the Sri Sri Radha Krishna Temple. I had a local friend take me and we listened to the monk tell us about how the pursuit of the material life was a waste. We read some of the texts and meditated for a time. The grounds are well-kept and the architecture is amazing.

Name: plpalani
Title: Divinity and peace
Review: We had gone to a marriage in a near by area and visited this beautiful temple. Huge one like any ISKCON temple and stories about Krishna,ISKCON history in Chennai etc are displayed around the Parikrama.The deities are very lively and blissful

Name: Sundaram R
Title: weekend viisit to iskcon chennai
Review: had been to iskcon chennai  last month.it was a very enjoyable from  religious/spiritual  point of view.they had a good collection of cheap value based books to offer for serious readers -life time collections .a place not to be missed taking into a/c all aspects

Name: Sumoy Sen
Title: Fabulous Temple
Review: The Chennai ISKCon temple is a great place to visit. It's on ECR and just before Akkarai if you are coming from Thiruvanmiyur/City, but if you are coming via OMR then you have to take left at Sholinganallur crossing, go through ECR link road and meet ECR at Akkarai, and then turn left. On ECR itself you will find the temple gate but the temple is far inside, almost nearly 1 km or little more. It has quite large parking space. The temple premise is large and the main temple itself can accommodate thousands of devotees. The good evening time is good as the temple is lit of different colored lights and also it is a fantastic experience to witness the evening prayer. Inside you will find Lord Krishna and Radha, along with Lord Jagannatha, Balarama and Subhadra. Also you will get to see Lord Gour Nitai.Inside temple while coming out a small section is there to purchase books, articles etc. The main temple and God idols are still first floor. The ground floor is also large and beside the temple you will find a small gift shop, and a newly built Radha Krishna veg dining hall. You will get a fantastic veg buffet menu items during lunch and dinner.Every year in the month of January the temple brings out the Chariot of Lord Jagannatha, Balarama and Subhadra and celebrates the Rathyatra - Chariot festival (which is basically in June-July in rest of India/world).

Name: Venkataraman R
Title: Beautiful well maintained magnificant temple
Review: This ISKCON temple is very richly furnished as other ISKCON temples. We went in the evening and it was well lighted. The temple is having ample parking space. The deities are beautifully decorated and enormous hall is very much suitable for prayer and meditation. The atmosphere is very conductive for spiritual activities. We chanted hare rama mantra for some time. Overall, very good experience.The temple main hall is also having lift to reach for older people. The steps to the temple is very wide and easy to climb with less number of steps. We also went to nearby gift shop for purchasing memorablia and prices are reasonable. we also went to food court for having some snacks. Again, food was of ample quantity and we thoroughly enjoyed.

Name: Raghavendran T
Title: Worshipping
Review: Time of visit in morning best time at 8 am teaching of Gita and 8.30am is Aarthi. Best place for yoga and meditation is morning only.

Name: BALASHOTELREVIEW
Title: Bala's Iskon temple visit
Review: Visited this beautiful Iskon temple on ECR road near Dhaba in Akkarai. Beautifully built well maintained and we were lucky as Aarthi was going on during our visit in the noon. Beautifully decorated Radha Krishna Jagannath and all other gods we worshipped and felt happy relaxed. We enjoyed tasty prasadam distributed free also available on cost. Enough car park space was available on charge basis.

Name: HappySheep
Title: HK temple
Review: Rather large building and premises for the Hare Kristnas, on the outskirts of Chennai, need transport to get there.

Name: OneWayCarRental
Title: Wonderful Temple
Review: Before attending my meeting with Business Partners, visited temple and had darshan of Lord Krishna, Radha, Balram. It is a peaceful place.

Name: yy m
Title: Serene
Review: This temple is situated away from the madding crowd and chaos of city life.Car parking is large.The temple has facilities for washing feet and hands before entering for worship.There is a wheel chair availability and wheel chair access ,also,lift facilities.The deities are so beautifully made in white marble.The sanyasis go about their business and one can spend as much time as one wishes.The agarbathis sold by ISKCON was recommended to me which I have bought this week during my visit but yet to use.Noticed a vegetarian restaurant but did not try myself.

Name: Priya M
Title: Big temple
Review: Being Krishna devotee I visited many ISKON temples around India. This temple in Chennai is serene clean and very peaceful.

Name: nageswararao g
Title: Magnificient temple
Review: Visited several times when I am in chennai. Its a good place and you feel spiritual every time you visit. Nicely maintained place

Name: mukesh t
Title: Peaceful.
Review: Beautiful temple with very beautiful deities. The temple has gift centre, and nice veg restaurant.A nicely built temple away from the main city.There is no entrance fees. Divine and peaceful, if anyone plans to spend a day away from the city chaos, this would be the best place. Be it with family or friends, you won't regret for a bit for visiting this place Nice place to visit

Name: Reshma R
Title: A temple made of Marble
Review: It is different experience going to ISKCON temple. the deity looks beautiful and the prasad is also different in this temple.must visit temple in Chennai

Name: Santosh Namby
Title: Serene beauty...
Review: It was a long journey from my home at Nungambakkam to reach ECR and the ISKCON Temple, but the journey was worth it. Situated outside Chennai, almost 20+ kilometres from the City, the majestic temple is a sight to behold. The 3 altars are beautiful and the food court is a must visit. One word of caution though, the temple closed for lunch from 1315 hrs to 1600 hrs and again from 2000 hrs to 2100 hrs. The evening closure is to prepare the temple for the Aarti at 2100 hrs.

Name: Ritika A
Title: Peaceful
Review: We reached the temple at 9 pm which was luckily the night Aarti time. The temple gets closed by 9:15 pm. Very beautiful and peaceful place. Prashad served outside is very tasty. Also there a big food court which serves pure veg food.

Name: Amitava G
Title: A nice temple away from main city
Review: A nicely built temple away from the main city. We visited on Janmashtami and the place was very crowded with long queue. Still the place was neat, clean and vibrant. There is no entrance fees. The people were in a festive mood. There was a food court but price was a bit high. The temple was beautifully illuminated because of Janmashtami but there was lot of slush and mud outside because of rain. It will be better if the temple authorities make the area outside the temple cemented. The parking arrangement was chaotic and we had to park the car quite far whereas many cars as well as autos were allowed to park right in front of the temple.

Name: ParthaDasIn
Title: Beautiful deities
Review: Beautiful temple with very beautiful deities. The temple has gift centre, and nice satvic veg restaurant. We had dinner buffet Prasadam in the restaurant. It was nice.

Name: Jeyanthi S
Title: KRISHNA JANMASTAMI
Review: Visited ISKCON Chennai on Krishna Janmastami with my aunt who uses a walker due to the after effect of a previous road accident. There was a long long queue but looking at her condition the Prabu who was at the entrance gate allowed us to surpass the queue and take the lift. The Bhajan and Pooja were so conscious lifting (don't have words to describe)

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Hare Krishna
Review: This is a nice ISKCON temple in Chennai.Good architecture and religious ambiance. Regular worship of Lord Krishna is done here.

Name: essaaren2016
Title: An average temple
Review: What stuck me at my first visit was that it was not as grand as it was portrayed to be, by my friends, though it was nice. The statutes were looking beautiful. The free prasad they gave‌ (though I donated a small amount in hundi kept near prasad) is again average.  They have a restaurant in the premises and I ordered Dosa. But they said it will take time (time was about five) so I left it at that. I ordered a Coffee there, it was below average. But none of this matters really, what matters the most it that the vibes there were more of a picnic spot rather than of a temple. May be this is true of all ISKCONs. May be I'm so used to typical Dravidian style temples which we find all over Tamil Nadu and anything else feels synthetic. I next visited the sai Baba temple and I found it far more spiritual than this one.

Name: Jayakumar KP
Title: Peaceful place with positive energy
Review: Hare Krishna Temple at ECR near sholinganallur Chennai is a place filled with positive vibrations. Evening Arati is beautiful and they give guidance for chanting hare Krishna maha mantra. You can buy chithra Katha books for children. Krishna story books is good for kids. Also you can have dinner on weekends. annadanam is also there on most weekends. Nice place to visit

Name: vasan224
Title: one of my favourite temple
Review: iskcon temple in chennai is one of my favourite temple, i liked this place because of peaceful, were i can did meditation.

Name: Neetu90
Title: Just Awesome!!!
Review: Visited there one evening, was lucky to reach at the time of last Aarti of the day. Got awesome Darshanam and not much of people maybe cause it was a week day. Food was delicious in temple's canteen/food court. Must visit if you in Chennai

Name: Vyom Sinha
Title: Come to Krishna
Review: A highly spiritual place , beautiful temple in ECR with very positive vibes. Come to Krishna consciousness with beautiful deities darshans.Its very pleasant here with great breeze always flowing. A great family experience.

Name: vjjhonty
Title: Worship and Peace
Review: The one of the best place for worship and having peace (ISKCON) which you found in every part of india. #LordKrishna

Name: Rudra Sharma
Title: One of the many typical ISKCON temples.
Review: I have visited many of the ISKCON temples in India, and Chennai temple is one of the nice temple among them. Although Juhu mumbai is the best and Mayapur is grand yet Chennai too is worth visit. All other things are as usual like elegance of temple, , shringar of deity idols, peaceful atmosphere and lovely aarti are exactly in typical ISKCON style. So if you are fond of visiting this place, you must visit and enjoy.The temple is located in a peaceful area so after aarti, if you are late and do not have own vehicle, please do take care of leaving early as regular public conveyance is a problem that we faced.There is a nice restaurant and food zone here. Quality is shuddh and saatvik, as is the name of the restaurant.Summarily,if you are in Chennai and enjoy visiting religious places, ISKCON temple is one nice spot as must visit place.

Name: Keertan
Title: Good
Review: Sri Radha Krishna Temple or ISKCON Temple of Chennai is dedicated to Lord Krishna and his consort Goddess Radha. The Chennai ISKCON temple also functions as spiritual qrt and cultural Center. There are 5 levels in this temple which sprawls over 1.5 acres of land. The Prasadam Hall is situated in basement; an auditorium where various cultural and spiritual programs are conducted is located in ground floor, whereas the huge prayer hall is located in first floor. There are statues for Krishna, Radha, Vishaka, and Lalitha. There is also statue for Jagannath Baladev Subhadra and Sri Nitai Gauranga. The first thing which welcomes you as you enter the portico is the true-to-life statue of a Cow feeding her Calf. There is a book stall where sovereigns, spiritual books etc are available for purchase.

Name: GOPIKA J
Title: ISKON
Review: A very peaceful and energetic atmosphere can be enjoyed here. Temple is well maintained and nicely structured.

Name: Saket A
Title: Good !
Review: It is in the OMR area near sholinganur. From Sholinganur go towards ECR beach. Beach is quite near by the temple. So keep some extra time if you wish to visit the beach as well.

Name: ambarksingh
Title: Soothing experience
Review: IF you want to participate/visit during Aarti, then you must visit this temple in morning and in evening. Very nice, clean & peaceful place.

Name: sushant singh
Title: God place
Review: Very nice and clean place. You must visit this temple in morning and in evening during Aarti. Very much pieceful place. You will feel that you have come to an heaven. Radha Krishna

Name: nethis
Title: pleasant
Review: quite, pleasant and peaceful temple. a must visit in chennai, it is located in ECR road.one will be blessed for sure

Name: Srinivasan2205
Title: A very good spiritual place to unwind
Review: It is in an isolated place off from ECR...attend evening Arthi at about 7PM.... it is very good soothing to soul...we get good food after darshan in a restaurant outside the temple but within the premises

Name: MohanaKrishnan S
Title: Great Place to visit!!
Review: Such a wonderful place to visit definitely one of a major attraction in Chennai. ISKCON Sri Radha krishna temple is located at ECR road, near to VGP golden beach. At the ECR road itself we can see the entrance Arch for the temple to identify and visit. Temple area is very vast and newly built with all the facilities like, car parking, lifts, refreshments etc. Lord Krishna with Radha statues are beautifully made in White marbles and over all temple is beautifully constructed. Regular Bajans and Poojas will be happening for all the devotees to sit and worship Lord Sri Krishna. Dont miss this place !! Over all a great place to visit.

Name: Prasad B
Title: Simple but superb !!!
Review: The holy place having the charismatic ambiance followed by well behaved Krishna devotees around.JAI SRI KRISHNA

Name: 592abck
Title: Radhe Krishna
Review: Nice temple, holy place, less crowd, spiritual and divine people around you, excellent maintenance. Need I say more?

Name: Umang A
Title: Narayan..
Review: Located on east coast road, this one of the modern beauty. Temple of swami Narayan panth is great place to visit...

Name: vibhadhamija
Title: Secluded and peaceful
Review: I was here with family though .Located on ECR road so amongst many resorts that are located this one is amust see as well .I have had the pleasure to visit this temple and they are located in Delhi ,Pune and this one lloked similar .Its not very far from Chennai central and is on the way from Chennai to Pondicherry and can be a stopover point .

Name: Manish M
Title: Peace and calm environment
Review: Eternal peace can be found by Darshan of Hare Krishna...chanting of Hare Krishna Hare Rama will bring joy and happiness here. Far away from maddening crowd. It is located on ecr, one the most happening roads of chennai.

Name: akhilchandu
Title: Best Temple
Review: ISKCON Chennai is part of the Centre for Spiritual Art and Culture and is located off the East Coast Road at the Hare Krishna land, Sholinganallur. Spread over an area of over 1.5 acres, the temple is constructed on five levels. There is a 7,000 sq ft temple hall on the first floor, an auditorium for cultural and spiritual programmes on the ground floor and a prasadam hall in the basement.In the temple hall, there are three teak-wood altars which house the deities. The deities have been sourced from Jaipur and Odisha.Designed under the guidance of Sri Bhanu Swami, the temple has imbibed various attributes from Vedic scripture and is inspired by the Pallava and Kalinga architecture. The entrance to the temple is marked by a representation of the universe or the bhu-mandala on marble floor. According to the cosmology of ancient Vedic puranas, the universe is described as series of circular islands surrounding a central pillar called Mount Meru. The design on the floor at the entrance depicts the same universal pattern. There is also a life-like statue of a cow feeding its calf at the portico.The primary purpose of the temple to transform the material self-centred identity into a spiritual identity of unconditional love is graphically represented by means of a magnificent chandelier that projects various colours on the walls and ceiling. The chandelier has 500 Himalayan quartz crystals supposedly meant to intensify the spiritual energy in the temple. The temple also visually displays various vastu shastra features. A booklet explaining all these features is available at the book shop, which is located near the portico.

Name: YashiR25
Title: Serenity and peace
Review: If there is one temple which one should not miss on ECR, it is this one. Well-maintained, can spend time meditating there. You get all holy and divine. Beuatiful architecture. Loved it

Name: Mady1818
Title: Gives you peace of mind
Review: Located at ECR (junction where OMR , ECR meets), this temple is spectacular. Being situated in a calm serene place, mental serenity is achieved.Would advise to take an OLA/Uber cabs and visit before 9 pm. Last arti is on 9 pm, I guess. Temple is neatly maintained and there is a prasad stall and a small restaurant. Must be visited without fail when you are at Chennai with family.Temple interior is huge with photos of Krishna and beautifully lit walls around. Three dedicated shrines for Krishna+Radha, Krishna+Balarama, Krishna+Subahdra (sister of Krishna). Happy visiting.

Name: Venkatesh Thirupathy
Title: Beautiful temple and pleasant palce in chennia
Review: Very divine atmosphere. you can feel the power of conscious inside the temple... Lovely music play all round the day and such a powerful place to feel yourself.. Stay calm inside the temple and concentrate only on chanting of Lord Radha Krishna..

Name: vijmail99
Title: Gorgeous temple
Review: Very Divine atmosphere. Went with my family last week. Very peaceful and serene. Not very crowded and disciplined. Lot of parking space too.

Name: Shankar_Kamath
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: The best time to visit the temple is around the evening time. All the lighting adds to the beauty of the temple. It is really maintained very well and organisational part has been exceptional. Temple itself is located in a place little bit inside from the main road ecr. And there is a food counter also on one side of the temple where you get freshly prepared items like juice, chaats, bhajis and all. Its really tasty too.

Name: Asgar A
Title: Pleasant place
Review: Its nice peaceful and pleasant placeYou can relax and meditate nicely.Beautiful architecture and lighting.

Name: Ragavendra B
Title: Nice place for a peace of mind!!
Review: Very nice thought of keeping ISKCON in Chennai. People can have a lot of peace of mind by visiting this place.

Name: BNSantoshKumar
Title: It was an OK Ok temple.
Review: Been to few other ISKON temples , which were too good compared to this ECR, Chennai ISKON .It is half a km away from main road, but doesn't have transport much public, also a little dark spaces between in night time walks .It has Function hall for leasing out for parties, sasthipoorti(60th&80th yr marriage,teach lunch) not sure if they serve non veg(confirm with management)  though the temple is strict VEGETARIAN.It just was like a profit making temple on my opinion, has food court selling, parking charged. 10 or 30 (not sure since 2 boards were placed).Everything is almost made into business these days.They forces visitors at time of Aarthi time to chant hare Ram hare krishn mantra(it was upon visitor to adjust and sit or walk away; No hard comments)

Name: indian1947
Title: In the abode of lord Krishna.
Review: A new added attraction on the E.C.R. is the Iskcon temple  a place to visit on your Chennai trip.A wonder amidst the residential houses. A well kept and marvelous temple  built  by the Iskcon holiness and grandeur amalgamated in right proportions. Go and pray for the well being of the mankind.get solace for your soul and submit yours self before the lotus feet of lord Krishna.

Name: sowndarya s
Title: one of the best ISKCON temples in India
Review: I been to ISKON temples in Andhra pradesh, Karnataka and Tamilnadu and i felt the ISKCON temple in Tamilnadu is the best.The architecture, decorations and arts inside the temple are too good.Very peaceful surroundings.Only problem is transport as we have to either go in own vehicle or book a cab to reach the temple but there is no frequent public transport

Name: Padcee
Title: Shore Temple
Review: If you plan a visit exclusively for this temple you will be quite disappointed. Compare to other Iskon temeples in Mumbai or Bengaluru, this is a very much a small one. The marriage hall is a big attraction here. So the visitors are for the marriage hall and they do visit the temple. The diety of Sri Krishna, Radha and Balarama are beautiful and well kept.

Name: AnilkumarAnandan
Title: nice ambience and maintanance
Review: Worth visit in the evening. spend 2 hours in their bajan. it was overwhelming experience. must see in the evening time. ample parking space available.

Name: tnbalaji90
Title: 5 stars without any doubt :)
Review: What an environment! Divine and peaceful. If anyone plans to spend a day away from the city chaos, this would be the best place. Be it with family or friends, you won't regret for a bit for visiting this place. They take care of your shoes very well ( which is very crucial in India ).

Name: Prateek Sinha
Title: Amazing Temple
Review: Really beautiful Temple, one of the biggest. You dont realize how big it would be unless you reach. The road to reach there is narrow however it worth being there

Name: Sram81
Title: Simple and Serene Temple
Review: Situated near ECR is this peaceful and serene temple. Try to visit during the aarti time for wonderful bhajan and dance from the devotees. Adequate parking ( chargeable) and nice canteen serving great Veg Food!

Name: SRIKAKOLAPU
Title: Spiritual as well as trendy
Review: Adding all the food options that are available and the parking space that's there this place brings in more people that the actual spiritual people

Name: venkat-Chenai
Title: Serene Beautiful Krishna Temple
Review: Very fortunate to visit this Temple where Radha-Krishna are main deities. Like in Puri Temple, we have Balaram-Subatra-Jagannath. Incidentally visit was coinciding with Krishna Jenmashtami, nice bhajans and dance were going on continuously. One would witness a divine presence of Sri Krishna when we sit down for 15-30 min. meditation. For those who look out for a divine place in Chennai, surely Iskcon SriKrishna awaits you in Injambakkam

Name: SN Chamaria
Title: A temple without temple architecture and rules..
Review: The House of prayer by a sect called ISKCON founded by Late Sri Prabhupad.  You will have a feel of grace..

Name: Sdey1986
Title: ISCKON - Chennai - A must visit ......
Review: Very well maintained place. Visited during 15th August 2017 Janmasthami and Independence day. Crowd was there but very well maintained. Has a very big compound.Pros:1. Well managed.2. Kept it clean after so much of footfall.3. Timing was mentioned for each activities properly.4. Food court and parking is there.

Name: Guha Rajan M
Title: Calm and divine Temple.
Review: Nice, Calm and divine temple. Good place to relax particularly if you spiritually inclined to discover self, away from hustle and bustle of city life. Looks magnificent with evening light with  good car park facility too.

Name: R G
Title: Serene heavenly place
Review: Visiting this temple is an awesome experience.You will feel serene for all time of your stay.the temple is located at a remote location but you can hire ola uber for your trip.the prasadam is very tasty.You can also plan a lunch with your family as temple premises has a veg restaurant.

Name: Triflyer
Title: Divine and peaceful
Review: The temple is very beautiful - much as you can expect any ISKCON temple to be. Added bonus is that the location is great. It is a 15 minute leisurely walk away from the beach, a very clean stretch. The food at the temple premises is a bit of disappointment though. When I was there, breakfast was to start at 10.30 am, which is very late indeed. I had to walk about 10 minutes to get to a veg food place at the beginning of Bhakti Vedanta Street. Guest house needs some upkeep too- linen and sheets were clean, and fan was working. Washroom could have been cleaner, hot water was not available, AC in the room was not working at that time. I still enjoyed the stay given the proximity to the temple, the very friendly and hospitable staff who make me feel at home, and were very warm and welcoming. Will visit again for sure

Name: Akila P
Title: hare krishna ! hare rama ! in chennai
Review: Not many would know that ISKCON is in chennai, the Aarti is the best to witness.. or other timings are also fine ... the gods are dressed beautifully and the chandlier in the middle is very special.. but it is wise to note the timing and then go .. but must place to visit

Name: ckrishnamohan
Title: Lord Krishna - Beautiful Temple in Chennai
Review: Lord Krishna Temple , you can get good darshan well maintained and organized  temple Attended Evening Aarthi . Felt very happy

Name: dinesh_j84
Title: Very beautiful temple to visit
Review: This is a very beautifully built temple. The deities are placed on the first floor. One has to climb many stairs to reach the first floor. However based on request, there is a lift facility available for the elderly people. The deities are beautifully decorated. On Sundays special poojas are performed. The temple has a dining area in the ground floor where free meals are offered on specific days. Private canteen is available offering meals and snacks. Big open parking area is available in front of the temple.

Name: Bala
Title: a beautiful temple
Review: the experience is one you get in any other ISKCON temple in india. the temple is well maintained, and beautiful. you can get a good darshan at any time

Name: Gugan_Ilango
Title: Beautiful krishan temple
Review: ISKCON Chennai is a beautiful temple for lord krishna. do go early in the morning to see the morning pooja.

Name: mukund s
Title: Peace of mind
Review: Ofcourse we visit any temple for peace of mind, but this one stands for the saying. Located out of the city on ECR, its a gud place visit on the weekends with family. The spritual ambience is excellent, and prasads are delicious.

Name: labal
Title: peaceful place to visit
Review: About 1 kilometer off the East Coast Road, this temple is in Injambakkam. There is a huge open ground in front of the temple and parking is available for cars for a fee of thirty rupees. The place is quite clean and worth visiting during the Aarti. Closed in the afternoons between 1 pm and 4 pm, the temple also serves food in the afternoon, post the Aarti. The Saibaba temple on East Coast Road is quite nearby and one can combine the visits.

Name: Arun K
Title: Peaceful & Blissful visit
Review: Visited this temple yesterday and it was quite good. The temple is well constructed and the quite neat and clean. Although the temple is covered by large vacant pieces of land which could be better utilized for building a neat compound as well.The temple interiors are adorned with numerous paintings of Lord Krishna and major points in his life are covered through these paintings. We can give donations as well and also there are many books which we can buy.Separate small shop for buying prasatham as well.Ample parking space is also available.Must visit temple in Chennai.

Name: Vaibhav Agarwal
Title: Very Nice and Calm
Review: You can reach here use ng ECR road.Very nice clean and calm  place.If you go at evening, you can enjoy Krishna Aarti and Dance. You'll really feel peace!!!!

Name: Afrin S
Title: temple with Very calm environment
Review: Very calm environment. Please do not miss the Sandhya Arati.Great place to meditate.Good place well maintained and peaceful environment.Good place well maintained and peaceful environment

Name: artheej2017
Title: Temple visits
Review: Well maintained and organised temple..I visit this temple on Sundays and in spite of heavy crowd, the queues are well organised and the temple premises are very clean and well maintained.Wish they have grown many trees in their parking lots and they had a gowshala..!!

Name: Ashwin V
Title: Devine place
Review: Must visit ISKCON if u r coming to chennai. The place was very beautiful and gives you a peace of mind. The gurus preach you on how to earn the love of the gods and other living things.

Name: arthi72
Title: A SILENT MARVEL
Review: this place is amazing.it has ample car parking.its easy to reach on ECR road.The main temple is beautiful and can hold lot of people.there  is an evening arathi after 6.the view of temple from the sitting area is marvellous esp at night.there is a small restaurant inside the premises.food is ok there.prasadams are avl  too.its tasty.the place is very calm inspite of the crowd.very organised area. well maintained temple.

Name: DrMurugesan R
Title: What a holistic experience at the ISKCON!
Review: Very lovely and peaceful ambiance with perceivable aura at this holy place very well maintained.A must to visit place!

Name: Vijay
Title: Good Dharsan and peaceful place!
Review: Visited together with family and by luck we were able to  witness the evening aarthi session by achariyas. The auditorium is very clean and even unconsciously, our mouth says Hare Hare Krishana hare hare...Steps are good and gives the feeling of mountain (!) climbing. But elders may struggle to pass on the steps for lord krishna dharsan.Prasadham is good. But the temple owned restaurant was not opened even after 430pm..we wanted to taste north indian chats items, which we missed so badly,,Big car parking area (careful..dusty roads, area) and you have to pay 20Rs parking charge.Road from main OMR is so beautiful to reach this temple though narrow one.,Overall, must visit atleast one time.

Name: deepika d
Title: Divine
Review: Architecture is too good. Gives calmness. The prasad given is stomach filling and yummy. The whole temple gives positive energy.

Name: GautamYadav
Title: Spellbinding Place
Review: A very beautiful place. In one word its mesmerising. I have been to ISKCON temple of many big cities and each time I am mesmerised by the craftsmanship. it is a clean and very calm place most of the time. We were there twice for a little more than 1 hour each time. I would definitely recommend a visit.
